Posts.Content: 6cooks wrote: Hi everyone, Went in for my weekly Taxol today. I have had 5 weeks so far, (prior to Taxol I had 1 tx of Taxotere/Avastin but do to extreme SE had to stop that.) So my onc asks me about my side effects from Taxol. I tell him about the neuropathy in my feet and  R hand and that it is getting worse. (feet numb all the time and fingers painful). He decides I have had enough Taxol. The taxotere (which was every 3 weeks) counts as 3 weekly doses and 5 more would be 8 total. I was supposed to start A/C after Taxol but he says no we are going to do FEC (which I have heard of but never researched-didn't think I needed to).  I was a little confused as to why he was changing everything up all of the sudden. What should I expect from FEC? Honestly, I already feel kinda crappy tonight, even with premeds and EMEND. Is it crazy bad nausea with this regimine? I am also triple negative and I mentioned to him that TN respond better to chemo. He said "some do but some are crazy aggresive and dont respond to anything" which kinda freaked me out a little since mine is Grade 3. He aslo said FEC has less cardiac effects than AC and that is also why he is switching me . Is adriamycin stronger or better even with its worse SE? Is he saving that in case he needs it later? Do they even do that?  Just a little confused. Any insight would be appreciated. Marci pressure makes diamonds! Dx 7/3/2008, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 0/6 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: ONC CHANGED MY TX! WHO'S TAKEN FEC? 6cooks Lynette

Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2008 01:20AM 6cooks wrote: Thanks all for responding. It is 4 days later and i (FINALLY) feel better. I was able to work today and the nausea has subsided. Marci
Posts.Title: ONC CHANGED MY TX! WHO'S TAKEN FEC? 6cooks Lynette

Posts.Content: Sep 21, 2008 11:55AM 6cooks wrote: Hey Suzy, I was also diagnosed in July but had chemo first so I am already (mostly) bald.  I recommend going to a wig shop to try them on, and then buying them online. I found out the hard way that they were much less expensive online (after spending 500 for 2 at the wig store). Now, heres my deal, I bought them when I had hair and now that I have lost it I don't much care for the wigs. They feel loose like they are going to slide off, they are hot, and lastly I am so used to wearing a ballcap that I feel stupid in them. That's just me, a little buyers remorse. Oh well, live and learn. If you do  want to get one the Raquel Welch brand has very contemporary cute styles.  Lastly I had dry hair before chemo and now it seems the few strands I have left get oily quickly, probably partly because I am always wearing a hat and I sweat alot. Hope that helps! Good luck to you in your shopping! Marci
Posts.Title: Wig recommendations? SuzyWillKickThis getwell

Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2008 01:49PM 6cooks wrote: Starmonkey, First let me say that this is the best site around. I was the same way but instead I have found it so helpful and the people on here are so compassionate and caring it lifts my spirits daily. My lump also grew quickly to a 4cm. I know waiting sucks the worst, mine was right before 4th of July and we were going out of town, but try not to obsess. I am praying that you get the best news possible. Please let us know and if you do find out it is BC, we are here for you. Marci
Posts.Title: i'm freaked out starmonkey219 CAZ

Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2008 01:57PM 6cooks wrote: Hey ladies, I am not a nurse but I am a respiratory therapist and I have been working with and best friends with nurses 15 years so can I join the party?? I work full time night shift at a medium sized hospital. Truly my work family is as important to me as my real family. They have been so supportive and understanding. They threw me a hat party and also gave me a check for $1000 to help me out. I was absolutely floored. MarieKelly that story you posted made me cry, there are soo many good people out there! Marci
